hideTemporaryDescription: This will hide the project. CodexFlow will remember hidden projects. You can enable "Show hidden projects" to view and unhide it.
hideTemporaryDescriptionNamed: CodexFlow will hide "{name}" and remember hidden projects. Enable "Show hidden projects" to view and unhide it.
hiddenProjectBlocked: This project is hidden. Enable "Show hidden projects" to make it visible again.
externalConsoleBlockedDesc: Unable to launch the external {env} console. Check your environment configuration and try again.
externalConsoleBlockedHint: Use the terminal mode switcher in the top bar if you need to change environments.
selectProjectLeft: Select a project on the left
createOneToStart: Or open a project to get started
renameLabelDesc: Only changes the label shown in the list; does not rename the actual folder. Leave empty to clear and revert to the default name.
renameLabelPlaceholder: Leave empty to clear the label
worktreeActionBlockedByTerminals: This action is unavailable because the current project has {count} terminal agent(s) running. Close all terminal agents and try again.
worktreeCreateDisabledChild: This node is already a child; cannot create a worktree (max depth: 1).
worktreeCreateBranchHint: Click: open create panel; Ctrl + Left Click: quick create worktree.
buildRunDialogDesc: After the first setup, it will run immediately. Right-click the button to edit anytime.
worktreeOverrideOn: This command will be saved to the current worktree.
worktreeOverrideOff: Inherits from the parent project by default. Saving will write to the parent project.
worktreeCreateDesc: Each engine instance needs a worktree and starts the corresponding CLI in the console.
worktreeCreateProgressDesc: Shows creation output. You can close this window and reopen it by clicking the branch badge again.
worktreeReuseHint: Nothing is preselected. Checked worktrees are used first; remaining instances will create new worktrees.
worktreeMetaMissing: No creation record found for this worktree (base/wt branch mapping).
worktreeRecycleTitle: Merge Worktree Changes into Target Branch
worktreeRecycleDesc: Merge commits from the source branch into the target branch. If conflicts occur, resolve them first and then continue; if necessary, you can complete the operation using Git on the command line.
worktreeRecycleProgressDesc: Shows merge logs in real time. You can close this window; merging will continue in the background.
worktreeRecycleRangeSinceFork: Only include commits after the fork point (recommended)
worktreeRecycleRangeHintSinceFork: Uses the fork point (merge-base) as the boundary and includes only later commits; this usually reduces conflicts.
worktreeRecycleRangeHintFull: Includes all commits from the source branch.
worktreeRecycleForkPointDesc: Used to determine the "after fork point" commit range.
worktreeRecycleForkPointSearchPlaceholde: Search commit messages (paste commit/ref and press Enter to validate)
worktreeRecycleForkPointRecordedNotAppli: Current branch selection differs from the creation record; recorded value is for reference only.
worktreeRecycleForkPointOverrideHint: Leave blank to use auto fork point; must be an ancestor of the source branch.
worktreeRecycleForkPointMissing: Cannot determine fork point: wait for auto resolution, specify it manually, or switch to Include all commits.
worktreeRecycleSquashHint: Squashes all commits from the source branch into a single commit to keep the target branch history clean.
worktreeRecycleRebaseHint: Replays the source branch commits on top of the target branch, keeping each commit.
worktreeRecycleSquashAfterHint: Tip: You chose Squash. This does not merge the source branch commit history into the target branch, so Git may treat it as “not merged” when deleting the branch and require a force delete (this will not affect the merged changes).
worktreeRecycleStashInfo: Saved base worktree changes to stash: {msg} {sha}
worktreeRecycleSuggestedRestore: After the base worktree is back to a normal state, you can run: {cmd}
worktreeRecycleError_FORK_POINT_UNAVAILA: Unable to determine fork point automatically. Please specify a fork point manually, or switch to Include all commits.
worktreeRecycleError_FORK_POINT_INVALID: Invalid fork point (must be an ancestor of the source branch). Please specify a valid fork point, or switch to Include all commits.
worktreeRecycleError_BASE_WORKTREE_IN_PR: The base worktree has an in-progress Git operation or conflict files. Please finish/abort it in an external tool, then retry.
worktreeRecycleError_BASE_WORKTREE_LOCKE: The repository is locked (e.g. index.lock or another Git process is running). Close the process and retry.
worktreeRecycleError_BASE_WORKTREE_STASH: Failed to auto-stash the base worktree. Please check the Git state in an external tool and handle it manually.
worktreeRecycleError_BASE_WORKTREE_DIRTY: A stash was created, but the base worktree is still not clean (e.g. submodules/nested repos that stash cannot cover). Please handle it in an external tool.
worktreeRecycleError_WORKTREE_DIRTY: This worktree has uncommitted changes. Please commit/stash or discard them before merging.
worktreeRecycleError_RECYCLE_FAILED: Merge failed. Please inspect conflicts/interrupted operations/hooks in an external tool, fix them, then retry.
worktreeRecycleError_RECYCLE_FAILED_STAS: Merge failed. To avoid applying your base worktree changes on top of a conflicted/interrupted state, we did not auto-restore the stash. Fix the merge failure in an external tool, then restore manually.
worktreeRecycleWarning_BASE_WORKTREE_RES: Tip: Merge completed, but restoring the base worktree caused conflicts. Resolve conflicts in an external tool. The stash is kept: {msg} {sha}

Tip: Merge completed, but restoring the base worktree failed. The stash is kept: {msg} {sha}
You can run: {cmd}
worktreeRecycleWarning_BASE_WORKTREE_STA: Tip: Merge completed and restoration was attempted, but dropping the stash failed. You can delete it later: {sha}
worktreeRecycleBaseDirtyDesc: Merging runs checkout/merge operations on the base worktree. Uncommitted changes were detected; choose an option:
worktreeRecycleBaseDirtyBody:
Continuing will do:
- Create a "transaction snapshot" to preserve the base worktree's 3-state (staged/unstaged/untracked):
  - Run `git stash push -u` to snapshot working tree content (includes untracked; excludes ignored).
  - Byte-back up `.git/index` to restore staged semantics exactly.
- Auto-restore after merge: normalize to a clean state, then replay the working tree snapshot by overwrite (no merge), restore the index snapshot, and verify fingerprints.
- If restore/verify fails: the stash/snapshot are kept; use an external Git tool to handle it manually.
worktreePostRecycleDesc: Changes have been merged into the target branch. You can delete this worktree, or reset it to the main worktree state for reuse.
worktreeDeleteDesc: Runs git worktree remove and deletes the dedicated branch for this worktree.
worktreeResetDesc:
Reset this worktree to match the revision currently checked out in the main worktree, and clean the working directory back to a pristine state.
This will discard uncommitted changes and remove untracked files (ignored files are kept by default).
worktreeDeleteResetOption: Keep and reset this directory (do not remove the worktree)
worktreeDeleteResetHint: Only reset to match the revision checked out in the main worktree and clean; it will not remove the worktree.
worktreeDeleteForceRemoveHint: Uncommitted changes detected: force removal will discard them.
worktreeDeleteForceBranchHint: Branch not merged: force deletion will lose commits on that branch.
worktreeResetForceHint: Uncommitted changes detected: a force reset will discard them.
worktreeDeleteBlockedByRecycling: This worktree is currently merging and cannot be deleted. Click “Merge” to view progress.
worktreeDeleteInProgress: This worktree is being deleted. Please do not repeat the action.
gitActionFailedHint: Handle conflicts/interrupted operations/hooks in an external Git tool, then retry.
ctxOpenGitTerminal: Open in external terminal / Git Bash
gitOpenTerminal: Open in external terminal / Git Bash
